oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COMPARISON OF DRAG AND INERTIA COEFFICIENTS FOR A CIRCULAR CYLINDER IN RANDOM WAVES DERIVED FROM DIFFERENT METHODS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mai, Tri Cao
Wilms, Mayumi
Hildebrandt, Arndt
Schlurmann, Torsten
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wave load
Morison equation
Drag and inertia coefficient
random waves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents results from experimental works to investigate wave loading on a vertical circular cylinder in random wave conditions in a wave flume with different water depths . In-line force coefficients (drag and inertia coefficient) are estimated from the measured pressures on cylinder's surface at different elevations along the length of the cylinder. The wave kinematics are estimated by using different wave theories. Methods of max-min and least-squares (simplified by fit on wave-by-wave basis) are applied to determine force coefficients.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; posters.23
